channel.title: Best way to get familiarized with C# and 3D Game Programming? (Discussion)
channel.description:
Hey so I've been wanting to learn some C#, but more importantly, game programming. I know you can do game programming in various different languages, but I've chosen C#. I want to know possibly what some good resources are, what the best game engines are, and the best programs for 3D Modeling. I've started some with using MilkShape 3D for 3D Modeling, and I've been working with the Torque game engine, being a programmer before-hand I already have Notepad++ and I've looked into UltraEdit32.
I have some base knowledge from a book I've been looking at called [i][u]3D Game Programming All In One[/u][/i] by Kenneth C. Finney, any other suggestions for books, any C# programming resources, or recommendations for game engines and programs let me know, will be greatly appreciated. -TWG
Edit: Before anyone jumps in and says something about this, I understand that there is a difference between C, C#, and C++, the reasoning behind me choosing C# is because it's probably the closest that resembles Java, and it is usually used for web-based applications, so I've understood.

item.title: Best way to get familiarized with C# and 3D Game Programming? (Discussion)
item.dc:creator: @Ecko Ecko
item.source: Best way to get familiarized with C# and 3D Game Programming? (Discussion)

item.title: Best way to get familiarized with C# and 3D Game Programming? (Discussion)
item.dc:creator: @The_Web_Guy The Web Guy
item.description:
@The_Web_Guy wrote:

[quote=“Lin, post:5, topic:465843”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=572578.msg4138628#msg4138628 date=1351925796]
lin would say use XNA
[/quote]You can use regular C# and XNA and have a 360/PC game, or you can use Mono and Mono XNA and have a PC game that runs on Mac, Linux, and Windows. XNA is okay, but I have problems with how high-leveled it is.[/quote]

Thanks Lin

Read full topic

item.description:
@_s11 wrote:

[quote=“The Web Guy, post:3, topic:465843”][quote author=Miss Silabsoft link=topic=572578.msg4138628#msg4138628 date=1351925796]
lin would say use XNA
[/quote]

Would that be good advice? [/quote]no, microsoft are phasing it out it seems (no more updates etc.)
